definition: variant of 繃|绷[beng1]/variant of 繃|绷[beng3]
to draw tight/to stretch taut/to tack (with thread or pin)/embroidery hoop/woven bed mat
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

sentences.english: That's why I have this Band-Aid here.

sentences.chinese: 对了，你的手怎么上绷带了？

sentences.english: The nurse lapped his wrist in a bandage.
sentences.chinese: 护士把他的腕部包上绷带。

sentences.english: She had just unwrapped her foot.
sentences.chinese: 她刚刚拆掉了脚上的绷带。

sentences.english: His left hand, which rested on his enamelled sword hilt, was bandaged.
sentences.chinese: 他那按在宝剑珐琅柄上的左手外面裹着绷带。

sentences.english: This too looked red and raw. There was no bandage.
sentences.chinese: 这里也红红的，好像擦伤了，但是没有裹上绷带。

sentences.english: I was tightly bandaged and not allowed to get out of bed for three days.
sentences.chinese: 我被绷带缠得紧紧的，三天不允许下床。

sentences.english: I don't think the cloth bandages can stop the bleeding. What we need is a tourniquet.
sentences.chinese: 我不认为布绷带可以止血，我们需要止血带。

sentences.english: Never make the bandage too tight as this can cause breathing problems.
sentences.chinese: 不要把绷带勒的很紧，这样会导致呼吸问题。

sentences.english: He pointed at her foot, which was wrapped in thick white bandages.
sentences.chinese: 他指着她缠着厚厚白绷带的那只脚。

sentences.english: And to think we once thought spray-on bandages were revolutionary.
sentences.chinese: 我们曾认为喷涂绷带是开创性医疗技术。
您是否需要一些绷带呢？

sentences.english: Cover the wound with a loose bandage or a piece of dry clean cloth.
sentences.chinese: 用宽松的绷带或者一块干净的干布盖住烧伤的皮肤。

sentences.english: There, the existence of a superior blood-clotting bandage can mean the difference between life and death.
sentences.chinese: 在那儿，如果有优良的凝血绷带就意味着生死之差。

sentences.english: The man's arm was wound with bandages.
sentences.chinese: 那人的胳膊上裹着绷带。

sentences.english: He ribboned his shirt for bandages.
sentences.chinese: 他把衬衫撕成一条条的绷带。

definition: variant of 包紮|包扎[bao1 za1]
to wrap up/to pack/to bind up (a wound)
